title: GateOpen​
content: </> PropsModule:GateOpen( Handle: Part ,-- Important, it represents the lock of the gate Hinge: Part -- Important, it represents the (often invisible) part the door is attached to (anything attached to it moves accordingly) ) → () Used to animate the opening of a gate (for gates in stables)

title: GateClose​
content: </> PropsModule:GateClose( Handle: Part ,-- Important, it represents the lock of the gate Hinge: Part -- Important, it represents the (often invisible) part the door is attached to (anything attached to it moves accordingly) ) → () The same as PropsModule.GateOpen except it closes the gate instead

title: LightSwitch​
content: </> PropsModule:LightSwitch( IsLightOn: boolean-- Important, used to know whether or not the light is on and therefore if the switch should be on On or Off ) → () Used when players interact with a light switch to make it move correctly.

title: OpenDoor​
content: </> PropsModule:OpenDoor( Hinge: Part -- Important, it represents the (often invisible) part the door is attached to (anything attached to it moves accordingly) ) → () Similar to PropsModule.GateOpen except it is used for simple doors.

title: CloseDoor​
content: </> PropsModule:CloseDoor( Hinge: Part -- Important, it represents the (often invisible) part the door is attached to (anything attached to it moves accordingly) ) → () The same as PropsModule.OpenDoor except it closes the door instead

title: StreetLights​
content: </> PropsModule:StreetLights( IsNightOn: boolean-- Important, if true, it will turn on every StreetLight, if false it will turn them off ) → () Turns On or Off street lights scattered all around the map. caution this can easily make the game lag if done too much and too quickly

title: SetClouds​
content: </> Weather:SetClouds( CloudsCover: Float,-- Changes how cloudy the sky is (between 0 and 1) CloudsDensity: Float,-- Changes how strong or thick the clouds are (between 0 and 1) CloudsColor: Color3 -- Changes the color of the clouds (optional) ) → () Used to change clouds (cover, density and color). Weather:SetClouds(0.5, 0.7, Color3.fromRGB(255,255,255)) --OR Weather:SetClouds(0.5,0.7) -- setting the color is optional info 'CloudsCover' and 'CloudsDensity' can have values above 1, but it will not be different than setting it to 1. Right now it takes 5s for the game to complete the modification, to change that just change the value in 'TweenInfo.new(5)'

title: SetWind​
content: </> Weather:SetWind( WindPower: Float,-- Changes how strong the wind is. WindSpeed: Float,-- Changes how rapidly objects hit by the wind move WindDirection: Vector3? ) → () Used to change the speed and power of the wind by changing the attributes of the 'WindShake' module. caution Changing the wind way too fast may result in the game lagging and objects supposedly hit by the 'WindShake' module to not move as they do not have enough time to adapt to the new settings Weather:SetWind(0.5, 2, Vector3.new(0.5,0.5,0.5)) --OR Weather:SetWind(0.5,2) -- Setting the direction is optional

title: Clear​
content: </> Weather:Clear() → () Will clear the weather of everything.

title: Storm​
content: </> Weather:Storm() → () Activates rain. Changes clouds' cover, density and color. Changes Wind's power and speed.

title: Windy​
content: </> Weather:Windy() → () Plays a wind sound Changes wind's power and speed

title: Cloudy​
content: </> Weather:Cloudy() → () Makes the sky more covered

title: Rain​
content: </> Weather:Rain( TurnOn: boolean-- If true, the rain will be activated, if false it will be turned off ) → () Activates or deactivates the rain info It does not modify anything related to the sky/clouds. Which means you can use the function while the sky is completely clear, it will not change that.

title: Init​
content: </> WindShake:Init() → () Initializes the wind shake logic and adds shake to all tagged objects

title: AddObjectShake​
content: </> WindShake:AddObjectShake( object: Part ,-- The object to apply shaking to settingsTable: WindShakeSettings-- A table containing the settings to apply to this object's shake ) → () Adds an object to be shaken info The 'WindShakeSettings' is a table storing values of the wind's direction, speed and power. Here is an example of how it is set in the module itself : export type WindShakeSettings = { WindDirection: Vector3?, WindSpeed: number?, WindPower: number?, }

title: RemoveObjectShake​
content: </> WindShake:RemoveObjectShake( object: Part -- The Object to remove shaking from ) → () Removes shake from an object

title: Pause​
content: </> WindShake:Pause() → () Halts the wind shake logic without clearing

title: Resume​
content: </> WindShake:Resume() → () Restarts the wind shake logic without clearing

title: Cleanup​
content: </> WindShake:Cleanup() → () Halts and clears the wind shake logic and all object shakes

title: UpdateAllObjectSettings​
content: </> WindShake:UpdateAllObjectSettings( settingsTable: WindShakeSettings-- The settings to apply to all objects’ shake ) → () Updates the shake settings of all active shakes

title: UpdateObjectSettings​
content: deprecated in </> This was deprecated in null Use 'UpdateAllObjectSettings' instead. WindShake:UpdateObjectSettings( object: Part ,-- The Object to apply shake settings to settingsTable: WindShakeSettings-- A table containing the settings to apply to this object's shake ) → () Updates the shake settings of an object already added

title: SetDefaultSettings​
content: deprecated in </> This was deprecated in null Deprecated in favor of setting the Attributes of the WindShake modulescript WindShake:SetDefaultSettings( settingsTable: WindShakeSettings-- The settings to use as default ) → () Sets the default settings for future object shake additions
